original: 15.71. Saraṇaduka, Vedanāttika🔽Saraṇaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saraṇaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca naaraṇo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saraṇaṁ
analyzed: saraṇaduka vedanāttika  saraṇam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saraṇam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma  paṭicca na araṇaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (The Paṭṭhāna Treatise, in the form of the Dukatika Paṭṭhāna, with the first two sections of the Saraṇaduka and the Vedanāttika.)🔽A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause.🔽A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause.

original: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽ca naaraṇo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  ca na araṇaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause.

original: Araṇaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: araṇam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause. A state that is not a refuge is related to a state that is not a refuge as a cause.

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.🔽Saraṇaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri  saraṇam dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to the unwholesome, there are four possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are three possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are three possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the wholesome.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Saraṇaṁ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā ….

translated: With respect to the unwholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are four possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are three possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are four possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the wholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the unwholesome.

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate cattāri
translated: With respect to the wholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the unwholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are three possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there are two possibilities with respect to the wholesome.🔽With respect to the unwholesome, there is one possibility with respect to the wholesome.
